sen.j: 下天津駅（しもあまづえき）は、京都府福知山市にある、北近畿タンゴ鉄道(KTR)北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Shimo-Amazu Station is located in Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture and is a railway station on the Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR) Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyafuku Line.
Shimo-Amazu Station is located in Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture and is a railway facility on the Miyafuku Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).
Shimo-Amazu Station, located in Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway facility on the Miyafuku Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).
Station Structures
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 西側に片面1面1線のプラットホームを持つ無人駅である。
sen.e: An unmanned single platform station with a single track running along the west side of the platform.
It's an unmanned single platform station having a single track running along its west side.
It's an unmanned single platform station having a single track running along its west side.

sen.j: 宮福線は駅北方、南方の両方向でトンネルに入る。
sen.e: The Miyafuku line enters tunnels both north and south of the station.
The Miyafuku Line enters tunnels north and south of the station.
The Miyafuku Line enters tunnels both north and south of the station.

sen.j: 駅舎は無く、階段で高架上のホームへ上る。
sen.e: There is no station building, and the platform above is reached by climbing stairs.
There is no station building, and the platform above is reached by means of a stairway.
There is no station building, and the elevated platform is reached by means of a stairway.

sen.j: ホームに待合室がある。
sen.e: There is a shelter-shed on the platform.
A shed on the platform provides shelter.
There is a waiting room on the platform.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: またホーム下には簡素ながらも自転車置き場と便所（汲み取り式便所）がある。
sen.e: Below the platform there is a simple area to park bikes and a toilet (septic tank style toilet).
Below the platform there is a simple area comprising a toilet (septic-tank style) and a parking space for bicycles.
Below the platform there is a simple area comprising a toilet (vault toilet) and a parking space for bicycles.
Station Vicinity
The station's surroundings
Station surroundings
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 国道175号から下天津交差点をまがり京都府道529号大呂下天津線を少し入った所で「下天津駅」と書かれた標識をまがってすぐの所に位置する。
sen.e: The station is located soon after turning near a sign that says "Shimo-Amazu Station" which is placed a short distance along Kyoto Prefectural Road #529 (Omiya Shimo-Amazu Route) which is found soon after turning off National Highway #175 at the Shimo-Amazu intersection.

The station is located soon after turning near a sign that reads "Shimo-Amazu Station," a short distance along Kyoto Prefectural Road 529 (Omiya Shimo-Amazu Route) which is found soon after turning off National Highway 175 at the Shimo-Amazu intersection.

The station is located soon after turning near a sign that reads 'Shimo-Amazu Station,' a short distance along Kyoto Prefectural Route 529 (Omiya Shimo-Amazu Route) which is found after turning off National Route 175 at the Shimo-Amazu intersection.
sen.cmt: 府道→prefectural route,国道→national route としました。"→ ' としました。

sen.j: 駅前には駐車場があり、6台ほどの車を停められる。
sen.e: There is a car park in front of the station with space for approximately 6 vehicles.
A parking lot in front of the station has space for approximately six vehicles.
A parking lot in front of the station has space for approximately six vehicles.
Usage
Usage
Passenger use
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員はわずか約8人である。
sen.e: In FY 2006 there were approximately 8 passengers per day.
The average daily number of station users in fiscal 2006 was eight.
The average daily number of station users in fiscal year 2006 was as few as eight.
sen.cmt: as few as を追加しました。fiscal year としました。

sen.e: (Source: Kyoto Prefecture statistics)
(Source: Kyoto Prefecture statistics)
(According to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report)
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）7月16日、宮福鉄道（現・北近畿タンゴ鉄道）宮福線の駅として開業。
sen.e: July 16, 1988: Opened as a station on the Miyafuku Line of the Miyafuku Railway (Presently: Kitakinki Tango Railway).
July 16, 1988: The station opened as a facility on the Miyafuku Line of the Miyafuku Railway (currently the Kitakinki Tango Railway).
July 16, 1988: The station opened as a facility on the Miyafuku Line of the Miyafuku Railway (currently the Kitakinki Tango Railway).

sen.e: Maki Station - Shimo-Amazu Station - Gujo Station
